intro: Vincetoxicum tortum, commonly known as the twisted dogwood, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern North America. It belongs to the Cornaceae family and is characterized by its zigzagging stems and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are attractive to birds but toxic to humans and livestock. Its foliage turns vibrant shades of red and orange in the fall, adding ornamental value to gardens. Vincetoxicum tortum is often used in landscape design for its unique form and seasonal color changes.
